Or do you mean just use `logError`?

Ah, I see. But, I'm still not sure that end users want to see stacktraces of analysis exceptions for debugging use.... Could we add a new internal config to turn on/off this error info in a server-side?

Just for clarification, although this class is under the `thriftserver` package, but it has nothing to do with the `thriftserver` and there is no such `client/server` thing here. It is only a single `spark-sql` shell process. 

For the config thing,  maybe we just need `sessionState.getIsSilent` and just like

```scala

                  err.println(

                     """.stripMargin)

```
Yea, I personally think the proposed one above looks better than that in the current PR.
